page.title: 04A DORNIE CHILDHOOD
page.content: Mr Duncan MacRae went to Dornie School in 1922 when he was six. The school was run by two teachers as it is now. Mr. MacRae remained at the school until he was 15. He studied maths,English and latin. The children had to walk to school and during summer went barefoot. They were only allowed to wear boots when the first snow appeared on Skye. There were no school meals but some people provided barrels of apples and oranges and large biscuits called Tobermory biscuits. They had cocoa to drink. Mr MacRae's childhood was spent on the croft. He had to take the cattle out every morning to the hill and bring them back at night. The hay for the cattle was cut with a scythe. This was done in bare feet and was quite painful.
